required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Metabolic Homeostasis in Chinese
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Metabolic Homeostasis in Chinese

collaborator.agency: Longhua Hospital Shanghai University of Traditional Chinese Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, explorative, open-label study among 120 subjects(100 healthy, 20 with Mets) will be recruited. All the subjects are assigned to four groups based on combinations of age, BMI and Mets condition. All the subjects will be given a 400ml standard meal with a macronutrient composition of 75g glucose, 60 fat and 20g protein and fasting and multiple postprandial time points samples (blood, urine and feces) will be collected. The primary objects of this study is to explore the metabolic homeostasis healthy condition of Chinese people through the capacity of the response to the meal. The study' protocol has been approved by the Ethics Committee of Shanghai Institutes for Biological Sciences.

detailed_description.textblock: In this study 120 subjects(60 males and 60 females, aged between 20 and 70 years) including100 healthy subjects and 20 Mets subjects will be recruited. The healthy subjects will assigned to three groups as followed: 1) 20 subjects aged 20-29 years with normal body weight (18.5 ≤BMI＜24kg/m2); 2) 40 subjects aged 30-70 years with normal body weight (18.5 ≤ BMI＜24kg/m2); 3) 40 subjects aged 30-70 years with overweight or obesity(BMI＞24kg/m2). All the 20 Mets subjects aged between 30-70 years will be assigned to the fourth group. On study days before the first blood draw, a cannula was placed and blood samples were taken at t = 0 (fasting) and five time-points (t = 0.5, 1, 2, 3 and 4 h) after consumption of the standard meal. Subjects were not allowed to eat or drink until the last blood sampling, except from drinking water. At t = 0 ,1 and 2 h, the fingertip blood will be collected as well. Body composition will be measured by dual energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA). All these samples will be used to the assesment of blood chemistry, metabolomics, single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP), gut microbiota and etc.

other_outcome.description: Concentration of serum E-selectin at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured
Concentration of serum P-selectin at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured

other_outcome.measure: Serum vascular cell adhesion molecule-1(VCAM-1) concentration
other_outcome.description: Concentration of serum VCAM-1 at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured
Concentration of serum ICAM-1 at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured
Concentration of serum SAA1 at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured
Concentration of serum TNF-α at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured
Concentration of serum IL-10 at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured
Concentration of serum IL-1b at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h will be measured

CRP are proteins that rises sharply in plasma when the body is infected or tissue damaged, CRP concentration in serum at fasting and postprandial 0.5, 1, 2, 3, 4h and the change curve will be measured
Metabonomics will be measured by liquid chromatograph-mass spectrometer, metabolic pathway analysis results will be reported.
Mutations at specific sites will be detected by gene chip。
Gut microbiota 16S rDNA will be sequenced, community composition will be analysed and the community composition differences between individuals will be reported.

arm_group.description: 20 subjects aged 20-29 years with normal body weight(18.5≤BMI＜24), male:female = 1:1
40 subjects aged 30-70 years with normal body weight(18.5≤BMI＜24), male:female = 1:1
40 subjects aged 30-70 years with overweight or obesity (BMI≥24), male:female = 1:1

intervention.description: Consumption a standard meal consisted of 75g glucose, 60g fat and 20 protein just for once.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- healthy subjects: age 20-70 BMI ≥ 18.5
- Mets subjects:
age 30-70 BMI ≥ 18.5 and at least meet three of the following criterions(NCEP-ATPIII, for Asian Americans)
1. Waist circumference ≥90 cm (men), ≥ 80 cm (women).
2. total triglyceride ≥ 1.7 mmol/L.
3. HDL-c <1.03 mmol/L in men, <1.3 mmol/L in women.
4. systolic blood pressure ≥ 130 mmHg or diastolic blood pressure ≥ 85 mmHg.
5. Fasting plasma glucose ≥ 5.6 mmol/L.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Diabetes or a history of medical or surgical events that may significantly affect the study outcome, including medication for diabetes, cholesterol lowering medication
2. Pregnancy or lactation
3. Gastrointestinal diseases
4. Severe renal disease or liver disease
5. Severe pituitary or thyroid diseases;
6. Mental disorders or current use of antidepressants
7. Cardiovascular disease, stroke or phase three hypertension
8. Cancer or receiving radiotherapy and chemotherapy within 5 years
9. History of drug or alcohol abuse or other substance abuse (Alcohol abuse is defined as more than 40 g/day of alcohol for woman, and more than 80g/day for man)
10. Suffering from AIDS, hepatitis A, hepatitis B and other infectious diseases
11. Attempting to changing bodyweight
12. Physical disability.

overall_official.affiliation: Shanghai Institute of Nutrition and Health, Chinese Acadamy of Sciences
